name: Michael Booth
biography:
Michael Booth attended the NIDA Playwright's Studio in 1996. His first play 'The Tunnel' was workshopped at the National Playwrights' Conference, and subsequently performed as part of '3 Strikes', the first program put on by the Tamarama Rock Surfers at the Old Fitzroy Hotel.

He has directed several theatre productions, including 'Spike Heels' for the 2000 Sydney Fringe and a new production of David Mamet's 'Sexual Perversity in Chicago'.

Michael studied acting at the Atlantic Theatre Company in New York, the Steppenwolf Theatre Company in Chicago, and has performed in many plays around Sydney.
